articles.title: The Simplest Android App for Scanning Documents
articles.description: Most scanning apps try to get you to buy a cloud storage subscription or pay for extras. Not FairScan, which is free and open-source, and has some powerful features.

articles.title: AI Digital Twins Are Helping People Manage Diabetes and Obesity
articles.description: As patients and employers look for alternatives to pricey GLP-1 drugs, Silicon Valley startup Twin Health is using AI and wearable sensors to help people make healthier choices.

articles.title: Toxic metals found in bananas after Brazil mining disaster
articles.description: Researchers investigating crops grown in soil contaminated by the 2015 mining disaster in Brazil discovered that toxic metals are moving from the earth into edible plants. Bananas, cassava, and cocoa were found to absorb elements like lead and cadmium, with bananas showing a potential health risk fo

articles.title: The Small English Town Swept Up in the Global AI Arms Race
articles.description: The residents of Potters Bar are working to protect the “greenbelt” of farms, forests, and meadows that surround London from the endless demand for AI infrastructure.

articles.title: Ancient DNA solves 12,000-year-old mystery of rare genetic growth disorder
articles.description: An Ice Age double burial in Italy has yielded a stunning genetic revelation. DNA from a mother and daughter who lived over 12,000 years ago shows that the younger had a rare inherited growth disorder, confirmed through mutations in a key bone-growth gene. Her mother carried a milder version of the s

articles.title: Ultra-fast pulsar found near the Milky Way’s supermassive black hole
articles.description: Scientists scanning the heart of the Milky Way have spotted a tantalizing signal: a possible ultra-fast pulsar spinning every 8.19 milliseconds near Sagittarius A*, the supermassive black hole at our galaxy’s core. Pulsars act like incredibly precise cosmic clocks, and finding one in this extreme en

articles.title: Scientists discover brain switches that clear Alzheimer’s plaques
articles.description: Researchers have identified two brain receptors that help the brain clear away amyloid beta, a hallmark of Alzheimer’s disease. By stimulating these receptors in mice, scientists increased levels of a natural amyloid-breaking enzyme, reduced buildup in the brain, and improved memory-related behavior

articles.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
articles.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

articles.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
articles.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.
